result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Velarde

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Christopher Velarde appeared by video.  Attorney Wendy Ann Patrickus appeared by video for Christopher Velarde.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a status conference.  Defense counsel acknowledges receipt of offer and requests a date for projected guilty plea.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Plea hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10-18-2022

Defendant Christopher Velarde appeared by video.  Attorney Wendy Ann Patrickus appeared by video for Christopher Velarde.  Prosecuting attorney James C Griffin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. Defense is requesting additional time to review discovery and offer with defendant. Case is adjourned in Branch 02.
Status conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher Velarde in court with attorney Wendy Ann Patrickus.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 064789,
Payable Number: 1019087,
Receipt Number: 22RP027988,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Christopher Velarde in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defendant wishes to retain counsel. Case adjourned for status of counsel, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher Velarde in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.  Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Supervision Report dated May 13, 2022 - received

Defendant Christopher Velarde in court by video.  Annie Louk appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Attorney Rakestraw is unavailable for todays proceedings. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Christopher Velarde in court with Student Intern Laura Federico under the supervision of Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Christopher Velarde in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Christopher Velarde appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
